item.title: Contact
item.description: Contact Thanks for stopping by. If you have any questions or feedback about anything on here, feel free to reach out to me on Twitter or by email.

item.title: Exploring the 2016 CCES
item.description: Introduction The Cooperative Congressional Election Survey (CCES) is an online survey administred to over 60,000 respondents every 2 years in two waves: pre- and post- the United States Novemeber elections. The survey asks many questions on the respondentsâ€™ views on public policy, social issues, and vote choice, and as such is a treasure trove for exploring U.S. public opinion and political behavior. A file with survey responses from voters in the 2016 Presidential election is available for download here.

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome I have been teaching myself R for a few years, largely through the great resources at DataCamp and other online courses, and working on a few projects on my own. I hope to use this site to share what I’ve learned and to connect with and learn from others. I’m a Program Analyst for the Federal Government (views here are entirely my own), and I have a background in health policy.
